After a few minutes of searching, we decided that Alpena had a few interesting things to do and booked the apartment.
Alpena is almost like a Hallmark movie village, and Chadâ€™s place is right in the middle of it all. We were able to walk to the grocery store, walk to the park by the lake, walk to dinner several nights at a variety of places, walk to cute shops, walk to the sunken ship tour boat, and bike to the sand beach a short distance south of the downtown area. It was an easy and beautiful drive to Presque Isle where we biked to both lighthouses and hiked at Thompsonâ€™s State Park. We also visited Rockport State Park and hiked in the quarry.
Check-in was easy. The apartment had a code for the door. When we walked in, we were greeted by 12-foot ceilings and an immaculately clean space. The kitchen, dining, and living room areas are open and surrounded by tall windows with blinds for privacy. The kitchen had everything we needed to make breakfast each morning. The bedroom and master bath are spacious. The bathroom has a shower with two shower heads and fluffy, soft towels. The queen bed is so comfortable!!!
Chad had excellent communication and left brochures and maps to help us find our way around. We were in town for really only two short days and three nights, but we packed in so much and really enjoyed ourselves, the apartment, and Alpena. We will definitely be back!

Most convenient location in the city. Decor is modern, with all the right touches. Everything is brand new. The bedding is very comfortable with cotton sheets and comforters. The living room is large with a lot of open space for gathering, while the bedrooms are closed off with a solid door for privacy. The kitchen is well equipped with every gadget (and more). The dining room table is a great place to gather and make food. Many condiments provided. The coffee provided is so good that we purchased more at their store adjacent to the house. White, fluffy towels are abundant, as well as striped beach towels to take to the beach. Camp chairs (5) are something that B&B's don't generally think of, but they were handy to take to the several picnics we had. They even have a large umbrella in case of rain. A large TV is in the living room, and lots of DVD's. We were able to use our Netflix and Amazon with the internet provided.
There is a full size washer and dryer, and lots of detergent. Having access to wash clothes is a bonus. And the bathroom and shower are very clean and the colors soothing to the eyes. Tamy really tries to get a "spa-like" feeling for the place. Bonus...one can book a massage right next door.
The only thing we regret about this stay is that we wish we were staying longer! We walked to every beach on State Street. There are so many cool things to do in Alpena, 5 days didn't cover what we wanted to see. This was the first trip to Michigan for my three cousins from Newfoundland, Canada. They originally booked a local hotel, but for a bit more, the three bedroom house was so much more enjoyable. They said it was the BEST vacation and BEST AirBnB reservation ever.
